The first two forums will both be held on Thursday, 8/13/20, one at 9:00 am and one at 6:00pm The links to these virtual forums will be located on the homepage of our district website prior to the events. We will also share these links on our Facebook page.

The final forums will be held on Tuesday, 8/18/20, at 6:00 pm. We look forward to connecting with our community during these forums.

Most families will experience a crisis (illness, loss, natural disaster, etc.) at some point. Whether it is a situation that impacts just your family or something impacting the entire community, families are affected in many ways. This webinar will provide the knowledge and tools to promote whole family wellness during a time of crisis: recognition of stress indicators, the development of coping strategies and positive communication.

Please share with families in your community and stay tuned for more webinars!

Trottier also coached basketball and baseball for our Varsity and JV teams and was even a member of the Hadley-Luzerne Board of Education in the 90‚Äôs.

Trottier currently resides in Greenwich with his wife and is a member of the Washington County Sheriff Department.

Welcome, Officer Trottier, we are thrilled to have you here (again ‚ò∫Ô∏è)!

This year we have an amazing opportunity for students to join "Wave Riders", a grief support group for children. A staff member of The Community Hospice will come to our school once a week for 6 weeks to facilitate a group for students who have experienced the death of a loved one. This group is open to grades 1-6 and will help students struggling with grief, while making new friends and understanding that they are not alone. This group will be a first come first serve basis with a maximum of 12 participants. If you believe your child could benefit from this group or have any questions, please contact Marissa Townsend, School Social Worker at townsendm@hlcs.org. You may also visit the website for additional information. Thank you!

https://www.hospicegriefservices.com/children-teen

Our hope in this experience was to encourage all students that anything is possible and to not be afraid or intimidated by the highschool‚Äìcollege transition. Many graduating seniors can feel anxious about making the jump to college life but discussing the challenges and facing expectations head-on with students who are experiencing it first-hand can help!

In an effort to improve traffic flow for our High School students during arrival and departure times, we ask all parents to refrain from parking on the street in front of the High School building. This area is strictly for student/pedestrian crossing and is a designated no parking zone. We understand that parking is limited in the front parking loop, so drivers who are waiting to pick up students are encouraged to park near the auditorium entrance in the back parking lot. This leaves room for our students to safely cross the street and limits traffic congestion on the main road.

With winter weather driving conditions on the forefront, this subject is of particular concern. We would like to keep this area clear and ensure all students can cross the street with high visibility for our crossing guards.

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact the High School Office.

On Friday, October 4, 2019, our high school students gathered in the auditorium to listen to motivational speaker and artist, Tom Verano.

Through artwork, music, and speech, Tom used his creative talents to captivate our students and enforce the importance of creating a world of kindness, passion, and hope.

His methods of speed painting mixed with inspirational speaking as a form of encouragement allow his audience to become emotionally engaged and inspired.

"Tom uses fingertips, palms, and multiple brushes to paint custom portraits and famous people on a 4 foot by 5-foot canvas in just a matter of minutes. His creations are all choreographed to powerful music that draws the audience into what is being created on the blank canvas." ‚Äì www.emotionintoart.com

We thank the Emotion Into Art team for taking the time to INSPIRE and share our passion for having a school environment that is #NoPlaceForHate

We are thrilled to announce that we have been recertified to continue our Primary Project Program! The Primary Project is a national evidence-based program that helps children Pre-K through third grade adjust to school, gain confidence, social skills, and focus on learning.

Our program is managed by Miss Margo and Mrs.Townsend, who spend time with students in our elementary "playroom." The Primary Project increases chances for success by enhancing social, emotional, behavioral, and learning skills while reducing social, emotional, and school adjustment difficulties in primary grade children. It is a program that works on fostering connection and relationship at school, with the self and others, through one-on-one free play.

Learn more about the program below!
https://www.childrensinstitute.net/programs-and-services/primary-project

Our Junior High students learned about Positive Behavior and Instructional Supports (PBIS) this past school year.

Throughout the year, students in grades 7 and 8 earned S.O.A.R tickets each time they displayed positive academic and social behaviors. The tickets were then entered into weekly prize drawings. The PBIS program culminated at the end of June with a Celebration Day!

Students without any discipline referrals during the 4th quarter participated in games such as capture the flag, tug of war, and dodgeball, along with a free BBQ lunch and a make your own sundae party donated by Stewart's Shops. One lucky 7th grader and one lucky 8th grader had their names drawn from all the S.O.A.R. tickets submitted during the year for our final prize a $25 gift card from either Amazon, Target, Cumberland Farms, or Apple App Store.

The day ended with some students choosing to watch a movie while others chose to go to rooms that had board games, arts, computers, and some enjoying more games in the gym. We look forward to continuing PBIS next year with even more success!
